meanings.definition: The process of making a task or process automatic or mechanical.
meanings.sent1: The mechanization of farming increased efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The factory's mechanization reduced the need for manual work.
meanings.sent3: The mechanization of the toy assembly line made the workers' job easier.
meanings.sent4: The mechanization of the printing press revolutionized the publishing industry.
meanings.sent5: The mechanization of the car production line was a game-changer.

meanings.definition: The use of machinery to replace manual labor.
meanings.sent1: Mechanization in factories led to fewer workers needed.
meanings.sent2: The company embraced mechanization to speed up production.
meanings.sent3: The mechanization of the bakery meant less kneading for the bakers.
meanings.sent4: The mechanization of mining saved miners from back-breaking work.
meanings.sent5: The mechanization of construction made building faster and easier.

meanings.definition: The act of introducing machinery into a system or process.
meanings.sent1: The mechanization of the industry brought new technology.
meanings.sent2: The mechanization of the farm improved output.
meanings.sent3: The sudden mechanization of the kitchen surprised the chefs.
meanings.sent4: The mechanization of the school system changed how students learned.
meanings.sent5: The mechanization of the hospital enhanced patient care.
